Text.text: You can add custom sections to your Object Page application to display additional content that is not covered by standard Fiori Elements building blocks.
Custom sections allow you to integrate custom UI controls, visualizations, or third-party components into your Object Page layout.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Section Configuration in Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Define your custom sections in the manifest.json file under the 'content.body.sections' configuration. Each section references a fragment that contains the custom content.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Section Positioning
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Use the position property to control where your custom section appears in the Object Page. You can place it before or after existing sections using the placement and anchor properties.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Section Title and Internationalization
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Define section titles using i18n keys to support multiple languages. The title property in the section configuration references the i18n bundle.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Fragment Type Configuration
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Specify the fragment type as 'XMLFragment' in the section configuration to ensure proper loading and rendering of your custom content.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Custom Section Fragment
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Create a fragment that defines your custom section content. This example shows a flight map visualization using the VBM (Visual Business Map) control.
